data.title: Who was Arnold Schwarzenegger
data.meta_description: Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger (born July 30, 1947) is a former American bodybuilder and actor from Austria, now a Republican politician, serving as the thirty-eighth governor of California…
data.text:
Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger (born July 30, 1947) is a former American bodybuilder and actor from Austria, now a Republican politician, serving as the thirty-eighth governor of California. Schwarzenegger gained fame as a Hollywood actor. ian in action movies. In the days when he was a world bodybuilding champion, he was nicknamed “the Austrian oak” and “Arnold the Strong”. He earned the nickname “Arnie” during his acting career, and more recently was named “the Governor” (the combination of the words governor and terminator, after the Terminator series). Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger was elected Governor of California on October 7, 2003. in a special election called the recall election (see also California recall election, 2003), intended to replace the former governor of the state of California, Gray Davis. Arnold Schwarzenegger was sworn in as governor on November 17, 2003, to serve the remainder of Gray Davis’ term until January 8, 2007. On September 16, 2006, he announced that he would run again for a full term in his election as governor. , which, incidentally, he won. In May 2004 and 2007, Schwarzenegger was named one of the 100 most influential people of that year. Schwarzenegger is married to Maria Shriver and has four children: Katherine (born 1989), Christina (born 1991), Patrick (born 1993), Christopher (born 1997).

At the age of 23, he made his film debut in “Hercules In New York”, but his success came 14 years later with the release of “Terminator”. He continued with roles in successful films such as: Commando (1985), Predator (1987), Total Recall…
